trans-unit.source: Using Blob Service Operations with Azure Premium Storage
trans-unit.target: Using Blob Service Operations with Azure Premium Storage

trans-unit.source: Azure Premium Storage offers a world-class cloud storage solution for Azure Virtual Machine workloads requiring high performance and low latency.
trans-unit.target: Azure Premium Storage offers a world-class cloud storage solution for Azure Virtual Machine workloads requiring high performance and low latency.

trans-unit.source: To learn about Azure Premium Storage, see <externalLink><linkText>Premium Storage: High-Performance Storage for Azure Virtual Machine Workloads</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=521898</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To learn about Azure Premium Storage, see <externalLink><linkText>Premium Storage: High-Performance Storage for Azure Virtual Machine Workloads</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=521898</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: To sign up for the Azure Premium Storage preview, visit the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/services/preview/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To sign up for the Azure Premium Storage preview, visit the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Preview page</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/services/preview/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Premium Storage is currently available only for storing data on disks used by Azure Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: Premium Storage is currently available only for storing data on disks used by Azure Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: These disks are backed by page blobs in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: These disks are backed by page blobs in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: This topic provides information about performing REST operations against page blobs in Premium Storage accounts using the Azure Storage Services REST API.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides information about performing REST operations against page blobs in Premium Storage accounts using the Azure Storage Services REST API.

trans-unit.source: Operations to create and manage Premium Storage accounts are available through the <link xlink:href="fdb2dbe0-c60a-4068-84b8-75dc16c558fd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management REST API Reference</link>.
trans-unit.target: Operations to create and manage Premium Storage accounts are available through the <link xlink:href="fdb2dbe0-c60a-4068-84b8-75dc16c558fd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management REST API Reference</link>.

trans-unit.source: You can also access page blobs in Premium Storage via the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Storage Client Library for .NET</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=398944%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You can also access page blobs in Premium Storage via the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Storage Client Library for .NET</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=398944%%amp;amp;clcid=0x409</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Premium Storage Supports Page Blobs Only
trans-unit.target: Premium Storage Supports Page Blobs Only

trans-unit.source: Premium Storage currently supports only Azure Virtual Machine disks backed by page blobs.
trans-unit.target: Premium Storage currently supports only Azure Virtual Machine disks backed by page blobs.

trans-unit.source: A premium storage account stores only page blobs, and only REST APIs for page blobs and their containers are supported.
trans-unit.target: A premium storage account stores only page blobs, and only REST APIs for page blobs and their containers are supported.

trans-unit.source: Any API called on a Premium Storage account must be of version 2014-02-14 or later.
trans-unit.target: Any API called on a Premium Storage account must be of version 2014-02-14 or later.

trans-unit.source: Azure block blobs and the File, Table, and Queue services are not currently supported in premium storage accounts.
trans-unit.target: Azure block blobs and the File, Table, and Queue services are not currently supported in premium storage accounts.

trans-unit.source: A premium storage account endpoint cannot be mapped to a custom domain name.
trans-unit.target: A premium storage account endpoint cannot be mapped to a custom domain name.

trans-unit.source: REST API Restrictions on Premium Storage
trans-unit.target: REST API Restrictions on Premium Storage

trans-unit.source: There are certain restrictions to bear in mind when using the Blob service REST API against a Premium Storage account:
trans-unit.target: There are certain restrictions to bear in mind when using the Blob service REST API against a Premium Storage account:

trans-unit.source: Only REST operations using version 2014-02-14 and later are supported for Premium Storage.
trans-unit.target: Only REST operations using version 2014-02-14 and later are supported for Premium Storage.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link> for details.

trans-unit.source: The number of snapshots per page blob in a Premium Storage account is limited to 100.
trans-unit.target: The number of snapshots per page blob in a Premium Storage account is limited to 100.

trans-unit.source: If that limit is exceeded, the <link xlink:href="64468b0e-315a-42ca-a090-e32e9bade1d7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Snapshot Blob</link> operation returns error code 409 (SnapshotCountExceeded).
trans-unit.target: If that limit is exceeded, the <link xlink:href="64468b0e-315a-42ca-a090-e32e9bade1d7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Snapshot Blob</link> operation returns error code 409 (SnapshotCountExceeded).

trans-unit.source: A snapshot of a page blob in a Premium Storage account may be taken once every ten minutes.
trans-unit.target: A snapshot of a page blob in a Premium Storage account may be taken once every ten minutes.

trans-unit.source: If that rate is exceeded, the <languageKeyword>Snapshot Blob</languageKeyword> operation returns error code 409 (SnaphotOperationRateExceeded).
trans-unit.target: If that rate is exceeded, the <languageKeyword>Snapshot Blob</languageKeyword> operation returns error code 409 (SnaphotOperationRateExceeded).

trans-unit.source: Reading a snapshot of a page blob in a Premium Storage account via <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob</link> is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Reading a snapshot of a page blob in a Premium Storage account via <link xlink:href="a3e943b4-5745-4e64-9d6f-728bbefbd5ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob</link> is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Calling <languageKeyword>Get Blob</languageKeyword> on a snapshot in a Premium Storage account returns error code 400 (Invalid Operation).
trans-unit.target: Calling <languageKeyword>Get Blob</languageKeyword> on a snapshot in a Premium Storage account returns error code 400 (Invalid Operation).

trans-unit.source: However, calling <link xlink:href="56a87f11-8f6b-44c8-b46f-7531d359875e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Properties</link> and <link xlink:href="17d768df-a804-45ba-b7f1-85ab5d79ec47" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Metadata</link> against a snapshot is supported.
trans-unit.target: However, calling <link xlink:href="56a87f11-8f6b-44c8-b46f-7531d359875e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Properties</link> and <link xlink:href="17d768df-a804-45ba-b7f1-85ab5d79ec47" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Blob Metadata</link> against a snapshot is supported.

trans-unit.source: To read a snapshot, you can use the <link xlink:href="b022aff3-053b-4bd7-9ebe-3f06e7e8f801" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy Blob</link> operation to copy a snapshot to another page blob in the account.
trans-unit.target: To read a snapshot, you can use the <link xlink:href="b022aff3-053b-4bd7-9ebe-3f06e7e8f801" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Copy Blob</link> operation to copy a snapshot to another page blob in the account.

trans-unit.source: The destination blob for the copy operation must not have any existing snapshots.
trans-unit.target: The destination blob for the copy operation must not have any existing snapshots.

trans-unit.source: If the destination blob does have snapshots, then <languageKeyword>Copy Blob</languageKeyword> returns error code 409 (SnapshotsPresent).
trans-unit.target: If the destination blob does have snapshots, then <languageKeyword>Copy Blob</languageKeyword> returns error code 409 (SnapshotsPresent).

trans-unit.source: Public access to a container containing page blobs in Premium Storage is not permitted.
trans-unit.target: Public access to a container containing page blobs in Premium Storage is not permitted.

trans-unit.source: Calling <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link> with the <parameterReference>x-ms-blob-public-access</parameterReference> header returns error code 400 (UnsupportedHeader).
trans-unit.target: Calling <link xlink:href="55958376-0879-4805-ace9-079d297ab3fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set Container ACL</link> with the <parameterReference>x-ms-blob-public-access</parameterReference> header returns error code 400 (UnsupportedHeader).

trans-unit.source: For additional error information, see <link xlink:href="a3c7e7f9-91c3-4550-8825-2e96a83fd99e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Blob Service Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional error information, see <link xlink:href="a3c7e7f9-91c3-4550-8825-2e96a83fd99e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Blob Service Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Restrictions on REST API Operations Against Disks Attached to a Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Restrictions on REST API Operations Against Disks Attached to a Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: When a disk backed by a page blob in Premium Storage is attached to an Azure Virtual Machine, certain REST API operations are not permitted.
trans-unit.target: When a disk backed by a page blob in Premium Storage is attached to an Azure Virtual Machine, certain REST API operations are not permitted.

trans-unit.source: These operations are permitted against the disk only if it is detached from the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: These operations are permitted against the disk only if it is detached from the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: If a restricted operation is called against an attached disk, the service returns error code 409 (SystemInUse).
trans-unit.target: If a restricted operation is called against an attached disk, the service returns error code 409 (SystemInUse).

trans-unit.source: The table below shows operations that are restricted for attached disks.
trans-unit.target: The table below shows operations that are restricted for attached disks.

trans-unit.source: Operation Type
trans-unit.target: Operation Type

trans-unit.source: Restricted Operations for Attached Disks
trans-unit.target: Restricted Operations for Attached Disks

trans-unit.source: Read operations
trans-unit.target: Read operations

trans-unit.target: Write operations

trans-unit.target: Delete operations
